title: Love Island's Maura Higgins says she was 'urged to dump her boyfriend of six months' by bosses
text:

Love Island's Maura Higgins has discussed how bosses of the ITV show tried to encourage her to dump her boyfriend so she could be on the line-up for the 2018 series.

The fiery beauty, 28, has opened up on being quizzed by the Love Island producers of the likelihood of her then relationship fizzling out in a bid to get her on the show which made her previous beau "very unhappy."

Speaking at Girls With Goals on Her.ie , Maura said: "I remember last year when they called me up and I was with my ex – we had been together about six months and I said 'no I’m in a relationship'.

"They were like 'how long have you been with that guy' and I said 'six months' and they were like 'well you don’t really know that that’s going to last' and they said to me 'if anything happens closer to the show, let us know and we’ll get you in there’."

The Irish native then added: "My boyfriend wasn’t very happy."

(Image: Phil Lewis/WENN.com)

Maura is currently dating her fellow Love Islander Curtis Pritchard, prior to be on Love Island she was engaged to her childhood James Finnegan, who she split from before having a six-month relationship with an unknown man.

On Monday, Curtis and Maura were seen putting on the incredibly amorous display once again at the star-studded Specsavers Spectacle Wearer of the Year awards hosted in London.

Oblivious to the star-studded crowd, the happy pair stuck their tongues out at each other while they got very cosy at the swanky venue 8 Northumberland Avenue.

(Image: REX)

A smitten Maura puckered up for a kiss with her beau while he captured the sweet moment on camera with a selfie.

Maura oozed sensuality as she brightened up her look with a red lip and she slipped her figure into a plunging white blazer suit.

Dressed for the glamorous Specsavers' event, the Irish beauty made a statement with her ultra chic glasses.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

They looked even closer when they enjoyed a cosy ride home in a cab after the event.

Maura and Curtis proved they were still incredibly loved-up, even though they aren't ready to move in just yet.

The professional dancer divulged the hot couple aren't been ready to take their relationship to the next level.

Curtis told The Mirror: "We haven't had a conversation about moving in together or anything like that yet. It's good to take things slow.

"You wouldn't usually move in together so soon – I've only known her for two and a half months!"
description: The former grid girl has lifted the lid on a discussion she had with Love Island bosses the year prior to her appearance on the 2019 series
